Issues.Title: fix(router): properly assign ExtraOptions to Router in RouterTestingModule
Issues.Body:
Previously, `RouterTestingModule` only assigned two of the options within `ExtraOptions` to the router. Now, it assigns the same options as `RouterModule` does (with the exception of `enableTracing` at the request of @atscott) via a new shared function `assignExtraOptionsToRouter`.

Fixes #23347

Issues.Title: feat(compiler): support tagged template literals in code generator
Issues.Body:
Add a TaggedTemplateExpr to represent tagged template literals in
Angular's syntax tree (more specifically Expression in output_ast.ts).
Also update classes that implement ExpressionVisitor to add support for
tagged template literals in different contexts, such as JIT compilation
and conversion to JS.

Partial support for tagged template literals had already been
implemented to support the $localize tag used by Angular's i18n
framework. Where applicable, this code was refactored to support
arbitrary tags, although completely replacing the i18n-specific support
for the $localize tag with the new generic support for tagged template
literals may not be completely trivial, and is left as future work.

Issues.Title: docs(di): improve documentation for the providedIn: 'any' provider scope
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description It is a bit difficult to identify use cases that can benefit from using the `providedIn: 'any'` provider scope and how it's different from other ways to configure Angular injectors. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ### What's the affected URL?** 1. https://angular.io/api/core/Injectable#providedIn 1. https://angular.io/guide/providers#limiting-provider-scope-by-lazy-loading-modules ### Reproduction Steps** 1. The description in the [`providedIn` option reference](https://angular.io/api/core/Injectable#providedIn) is short and precise, but not very helpful in this regard: >Provides a unique instance in each lazy loaded module while all eagerly loaded modules share one instance. 1. The description in the [*Providing dependencies in modules* guide](https://angular.io/guide/providers#limiting-provider-scope-by-lazy-loading-modules) explains how the dependency is resolved, but does not give useful examples of dependencies that could benefit from this approach. ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** It would be great to list at least one simple example that is realistic and easy to understand. Also, we could explain how it's different from other ways of configuring injectors. My thoughts on the `providedIn: 'any'` provider scope: - It is useful to control stateful dependencies that vary between feature modules. - It is a tree-shakable alternative to the `forRoot`/`forChild` pattern. It keeps the dependency tree-shakable, where as if it was provided in Angular module metadata, it would always be included in the bundle, even if no component was using this dependency. - It is useful for configurations, logging, analytics, and metrics. One of the techniques is described in [A detailed look at Angular's 'root' and 'any' provider scopes](https://indepth.dev/angulars-root-and-any-provider-scopes/). ## üì∑Screenshot ## üî• Exception or Error
## üåç Your Environment ### Browser info ### Anything else relevant? Current version: Angular 10.1.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs(di): improve documentation for the providedIn: 'any' provider scope" (#39112)

Issues.Title: feat(compiler): parse unterminated interpolations
Issues.Body:
This patch supports parsing unterminated interpolations as if they were
well-formed by

- including content until the next interpolation, if there is one, or
- including content until the end of the passed string to split
  interpolations in.

Furthermore an error is emitted in such cases, marking interpolations
that are not terminated.

Note that this is a breaking change; previously, malformed
interpolations would just be treated as text. A case where this was
useful was in treating interpolations as raw text via a pattern like

```
{{ 1 + 2 }<!--->}
```

A workaround for this is to swap the location of the comment, so that
the LTR parser would not treat this as intended to be an interpolation.

```
{<!--->{ 1 + 2 }}
```

Part of #38596

Issues.Title: fix(core): migrate relative link resolution with single quotes
Issues.Body:
This is a roll forward of #39082, using ```ts.createIdentifier(`'legacy'`)``` as a cross-version compatible way of making
a single quoted string literal.

Migrated code now uses single quotes, which is in line with the default linting options, so there is no lint error after
migration.

Issues.Title: Angular 7 libraries do not support APP_INITIALIZER unless the library is in the same application
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? Unknown ### Description Angular app initializer factory functions only run when the library is contained in the same application directory as the client application. Eg an angular application with a projects folder can be used to build the project and import the angular library. This will cause the factory function to run. generating a new app and using npm link to also make use of that library will not trigger the factory function to run. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Due to the nature of npm link used as part of reproduction stackbitz wouldnt help so I have created a repository: https://github.com/CraigComeOnThisNameCantBeTaken/angular_init_bug_reproduce Download and build the library found in AppInitError > navigate to the resulting dist folder> npm link serve AppInitError > observe the console.log running navigate to usesNpmLink > npm link under-test serve usesNpmLink > observe that the console.log does NOT run ## üî• Exception or Error Silent issue ## üåç Your Environment Windows 10 **Angular Version:**

Node: 8.11.3
OS: win32 x64
Angular:

Issues.Title: Inline SourceMap Option
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

Related issue: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/13543

### Command 

- [X] build
- [X] serve

### Description

Please consider a inline source map option again. It's just one more option. It's easy to implement in the Angular webpack config. It's just one attribute. See [docs](https://angular.io/cli/build).

### Describe the solution you'd like

 I suggest option `sourceMapType` or a new value.
Why not? Just add `devtool: 'inline-source-map'` to the `webpack.config.js` if this option is set.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

I don't want additional dependencies, plugins or hacks. Just an official option in the build CLI. Please üôè 
Btw. `ngx-build-plus` does not work. I don't want to rely on these 3rd party libs. Another risky build breaker.
It's really just a minor change in Angular CLI, or not?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Inline SourceMap Option" (#18975)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): add blank line in migration commit message
Issues.Body:
When using the `-C` option of `update`, the commit message of the migration is missing a blank line between the subject and body. 

For example,

Previously was missing blank line after the commit subject:
```
@angular/cli migration - rename-browserslist-config
Update Browserslist configuration file name to '.browserslistrc' from deprecated 'browserslist'.
```

Now fixed:
```
@angular/cli migration - rename-browserslist-config

Update Browserslist configuration file name to '.browserslistrc' from deprecated 'browserslist'.
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/cli): add blank line in migration commit message" (#18971)

Issues.Title: Curly brace positioned incorrectly in new angular.json file
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [x] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Perhaps, but not recent. ### Description When creating a new project, the very end of `angular.json` has 2 curly braces on the same line next to each other. The second one should be indented on the next line. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Create a new project with `ng new`, scroll to the very bottom of the created `angular.json` file, and notice the 2 curly braces right above `defaultProject`. ## üåç Your Environment 
Angular CLI: 10.1.4
Node: 14.13.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular:
...
Ivy Workspace:

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.1001.4 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/core         10.1.4 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/schematics   10.1.4 (cli-only)
@schematics/angular          10.1.4 (cli-only)
@schematics/update           0.1001.4 (cli-only)
**Anything else relevant?** How it looks now: ![Bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3020941/95007374-f7025000-05dc-11eb-9385-ac8c7fb5a868.png) How it should look: ![Fixed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3020941/95007377-fec1f480-05dc-11eb-815f-a72fd5017360.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Curly brace positioned incorrectly in new angular.json file" (#18968)

Issues.Title: bug(MatCheckbox/MatSlideToggle/DragDrop): Components not functioning in mobile under upgraded angularjs material to angular material project
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

I've created a stackblitz for this: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-qhprlc
You can view the issue in mobile: https://angular-ivy-qhprlc.stackblitz.io/

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an angularjs to angular upgrade project which includes both angularjs material and angular material.
2. Add a MatCheckbox, MaxSlideToggle, or DragDrop list.
 
#### Expected Behavior

I expect the checkbox to check when tapped.

I expect the slidetoggle to toggle when tapped.

I expect to be able to sort the list when taping and dragging on an item.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

MatCheckbox will display the ripple effect, but not become checked when tapped.

MatSlideToggle also displays the ripple effect, but does not toggle when tapped.

The dragdrop list will pick up the item and move it when tapped and drag. Releasing the tap does not drop the time. Tapping again in the list will move the item originally selected to the new place tapped. Tapping outside of the list will drop the item where it was released.

Note this a further investigation of issues #19466 and #17146, which I've finally been able to get a repo on stackblitz for.
https://github.com/angular/components/issues/19466
https://github.com/angular/components/issues/17146

#### Environment

- Angular: 7.2.8, 8.2.7, 9.1.0, 10.1.4
- CDK/Material: 7.2, 8.2, 9.2, 10.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows, Android
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(MatCheckbox/MatSlideToggle/DragDrop): Components not functioning in mobile under upgraded angularjs material to angular material project" (#20724)

Issues.Title: bug(material): Pink/Blue Grey themes not not working
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

The stackblitz : https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-fj2vxv?file=angular.json

Steps to reproduce:
1.  `npm install -g @angular/cli`
2.  `ng new my-dream-app`
3.  `cd my-dream-app`
4.  `ng add @angular/material`
5.  _Choose a prebuilt theme name, or "custom" for a custom theme:_ Pink/Blue Grey
6.  _Set up global Angular Material typography styles?_ Yes
7.  _Set up browser animations for Angular Material?_ Yes

Into the `app` folder

**app.module.ts**
```ts
import { NgModule } from '@angular/core';
import { FormsModule } from '@angular/forms';
import { MatFormFieldModule } from '@angular/material/form-field';
import { MatInputModule } from '@angular/material/input';
import { BrowserModule } from '@angular/platform-browser';
import { BrowserAnimationsModule } from '@angular/platform-browser/animations';
import { AppComponent } from './app.component';

@NgModule({
  imports: [
    BrowserModule,
    BrowserAnimationsModule,
    FormsModule,
    MatInputModule,
    MatFormFieldModule,
  ],
  declarations: [AppComponent],
  bootstrap: [AppComponent],
})
export class AppModule {}
```

**app.component.html**
```html
<form class="example-form">
  <mat-form-field class="example-full-width">
    <mat-label>Favorite food</mat-label>
    <input matInput placeholder="Ex. Pizza" value="Sushi" />
  </mat-form-field>

  <mat-form-field class="example-full-width">
    <mat-label>Leave a comment</mat-label>
    <textarea matInput placeholder="Ex. It makes me feel..."></textarea>
  </mat-form-field>
</form>

```

#### Actual Behavior
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44493964/95019988-d54eaa80-0668-11eb-9052-1b979ac4ab58.png)

- Angular: 10.1.4

- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows

Issues.Title: fix(material/slider): some screen readers announcing long decimal values
Issues.Body:
It looks like some screen readers announce the value of a slider by calculating the percentage themselves using the `aria-valuemin`, `aria-valuemax` and `aria-valuenow`. The problem is that they don't round down the decimals so for a slider between 0 and 1 with a step of 0.1, they end up reading out values like 0.20000068. These changes work around the issue by setting `aria-valuetext` to the same value that we shown in the thumb which we truncate ourselves.

Fixes #20719.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/slider): some screen readers announcing long decimal values" (#20721)

Issues.Title: bug(cdk-table): Row differ (trackBy) does not detect row template changes
Issues.Body:
The CDK Table will detect changes in rows based on a differ which is based on the `trackBy` input function.

https://github.com/angular/components/blob/4152aec5d421d993246b1ede3803027082330492/src/cdk/table/table.ts#L517-L519

This is fine when actual data changes but it does not handle a scenario where the row template has changed but the data has not changed, which is an issue especially when working with virtual scroll.

Since the trackBy handler does not get access to the `rowDef`, only to the index and raw row data, it is not possible to workaround.
 > Even if there is access to the rowDef, trackBy is not a predicate so it will be hard to return something logical there, trackBy is for identity, this one needs to happen outside of the trackBy

In some cases, one might write an alternate `trackBy` function but it will not do for all scenarios. Moreover, the `trackBy` function must be dead simple and fast, if the view port is large, showing enough rows with enough columns it becomes a bottleneck.

Usually, most performant way to do the trackBy is just return the index.

However, if the rowDef has changed, it will not be possible to detect it.

Once diff has been calculated, the call to `renderRows` will ignore the change in the row template definition

https://github.com/angular/components/blob/4152aec5d421d993246b1ede3803027082330492/src/cdk/table/table.ts#L611-L623

It will not call `_renderCellTemplateForItem` leaving it with the old template cached in the table.


#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-qvzms7?file=src%2Fapp%2Ftable-flex-basic-example.ts

Basically, we need to have multiple row definitions (CdkRowDef) but `multiTemplateDataRows` is set to false.
We define 2 row templates with `when` predicates, where the 2 predicates are opposite, if one is on the other is off and vice versa.

Using a simple button to toggle a boolean flag we switch between the 2 predicates.

If we use a simple button it will not work, we switch the flag but it does not change the rendered template for the row.

Using the `ChangeDetectorRef` to run manual CD will not work as well because the table handles it's own diff mechanism when it comes to row diffing.

The only way (I found so far...) to force the proper row template to render is calling `_forceRenderDataRows();`  which is private. The will force render the entire dataset, using the new row template. This is bad of course, as it's using a private method and it will force render ALL rows, while in real scenarios one will only want some to re-render.
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
Being able to change the row definition template and have the CDK Table autodetect and render it.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
CDK Table fail to detect changes in the row definition template.

#### Environment

- Angular: 10+
- CDK/Material: 10+
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk-table): Row differ (trackBy) does not detect row template changes" (#20717)

Issues.Title: feat(cdk/testing): add the ability to dispatch arbitrary events
Issues.Body:
Allows for arbitrary events to be dispatched through a `TestElement`. This covers the following use cases:
1. Some events can't be simulated easily without a user interaction (e.g. `change` event on an `input`).
2. Allows for custom DOM event handlers to be triggered.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(cdk/testing): add the ability to dispatch arbitrary events" (#20714)

Issues.Title: fix(material/menu): getLabel not working if text is inside indirect descendant node
Issues.Body:
Currently `MatMenuItem.getLabel` only looks at direct descendant text nodes in order to figure out its text while excluding things like icons. This breaks down if there's some kind of wrapper in the menu item.

These changes fix the issue by using `textContent` and excluding icons specifically.

Fixes #20200.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/menu): getLabel not working if text is inside indirect descendant node" (#20705)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/drag-drop): error if dragging starts from active sibling container
Issues.Body:
Currently we have a restriction that prevents users from starting a new drag sequence if an item within the same container is being dragged, however they can start one from a connected container and pull the item into the active one and start dragging it there. This can cause an error if it happens while the item's drop animation is running.

These changes add an extra check so that dragging can't be started out of a connected container either.

Relates to #20623.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(cdk/drag-drop): error if dragging starts from active sibling container" (#20704)

Issues.Title: bug(slider): JAWS incorrectly announces MatSlider value changes
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Default slider with no modifications: https://angular-cxwukz.stackblitz.io

Steps to reproduce:
1. Enable JAWS
2. Focus on the slider, and hold down left or right arrow to move slider.
 
Does not repro with NVDA or ChromeVox.
 
#### Expected Behavior

Slider will move while button is pressed and stop when it is  not. JAWS will announce the slider values as the slider is moved.


#### Actual Behavior

The slider keeps moving, and JAWS says nothing.  When the slider stops moving, JAWS repeats the value multiple times.  "79 79 79 79 79 79".


#### Environment

- Angular: Google
- CDK/Material: Google
- Browser(s): Chrome 85
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10 Pro
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(slider): JAWS incorrectly announces MatSlider value changes " (#20701)

Issues.Title: fix(material/datepicker): lifecycle hooks not being called
Issues.Body:
Lifecycle hooks are not being called in some cases due to a weird
interaction between extending TS mixins, running in view engine, and
transpiling the code with tsickle.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/datepicker): lifecycle hooks not being called" (#20700)

Issues.Title: feat(material/autocomplete): add the ability to auto-select the active option while navigating
Issues.Body:
Adds the `autoSelectActiveOption` input to `mat-autocomplete` which allows the consumer to opt into the behavior where the autocomplete will assign the active option value as the user is navigating through the list. The value is only propagated to the model once the panel is closed.

There are a couple of UX differences when the new option is enabled:
1. If the user presses escape while there's a pending auto-selected option, the value is reverted to the last text they typed before they started navigating.
2. If the user clicks away, tabs away or presses enter while there's a pending option, it will be selected.

The aforementioned UX differences are based on the Google search autocomplete and one of the examples from the W3C here:
https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices-1.1/examples/combobox/aria1.1pattern/listbox-combo.html

![demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4450522/94799944-93193500-03ec-11eb-9d76-af08dc44da78.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(material/autocomplete): add the ability to auto-select the active option while navigating" (#20699)
